description: Alcaparras Argentinas is a cooperative based in Santiago del Estero, Argentina, founded in the 1990s by a renowned doctor. It unites 32 small producers to cultivate and process capers and gourmet products from local ingredients often discarded. The initiative emphasizes sustainability, innovation, and community support, transforming food waste into high-value products. With a focus on biotechnology and export, they aim to enhance local economies while addressing food insecurity in a region facing significant poverty challenges.
name: Alcaparras Argentinas
